intro: Lavenia dentata, commonly known as the serrated lavenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom during the summer months. Lavenia dentata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
